snippet: Fifty-four people have been killed in Kenya’s north in fighting that the police say was started by a cattle raid, the Kenya Red Cross said Wednesday.
abstract: Kenya Red Cross reports deaths of 54 people in fighting in country's north that police say began with a cattle raid; attack also leaves five others injured and hundreds displaced from their homes.
lead_paragraph: Fifty-four people have been killed in Kenya’s north in fighting that the police say was started by a cattle raid, the Kenya Red Cross said Wednesday.

headline.main: Kenya: Dozens Killed in Fighting Tied to Cattle Raid
headline.print_headline: Africa; Kenya: Dozens Killed in Fighting Tied to Cattle Raid
